formalText: She wakes up from her nightmares and feel and over and overwhelming sense that she can't protect her daughters.
Sleeping well,  she doesn't want to sleep, sleep brings nightmares with it and she has the same nightmares over and over.
She feels like she can't live her life.
She does not want to be around groups of people.
She feels irritable and has been having trouble with concentrating and remembering things.
She is 28 years old and feels like an old lady.
It is possible that the ages of her daughters May trigger some of her memories?
She feels that she has less patience with her daughters and that she also feels that she spaces out more, having a hard time concentrating and sticking with tasks.
She feels like she is suffocating and like she needs space.
She worries about her daughters being harmed.
When she was a teenager she has a suicide plan, she would take a bunch of pills or just get into her mom's car and turn it on and go to sleep in the close-up garage.
She had the panic attack and she don't feel entirely safe in the house.
She has had nightmares for years throughout her childhood.

She believes this all began with a panic attack, she thought she was having a heart issues but realize that she was having a panic attack. She figured it was due to the split with her husband and moving back to her hometown and into the old house
She smoked cigarettes a pack a day started when she quit alcohol
She went through treatment for her drinking and has been sober for eight years.
She has never had drug used.
She loved her grandparents as a child.
She loved that house except for the basement.
She used to have to play with her cousin the basement.
He was not a nice person, five years older than her, and liked to teach her all sorts of things sexual things.
She was only five at the time and didn't understand.
She felt dirty and ashamed she didn't tell anyone until she was an adult.
Her mom was depressed and had issues.
Her husband was emotionally and mentally abusive to her not always but they  just couldn't seem to work things out.
She has noticed her nausea and loss of appetite since the separation from her husband and since moving into her grandparents' house again.
